intro: Hieracium rubricymigerum, commonly known as the red-haired hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and open areas, such as roadsides and meadows. It produces bright yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance.
